actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-118, by Mr. Gordon.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2686. The Resolution waives all points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2(l)(6) of rule XI and clause 7 of rule XXI. During consideration of the bill, all points of order against the provisions in the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2 of rule XXI shall be waived, with the excetption of certain provisions specified in the text of the resolution.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 32.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 200 - 168 (Roll no. 188).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 2686) making appropriations for the Department of the Interior and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 2686 (Department of the Interior and related agencies funding).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 2686) making appropriations for the Department of the Interior and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.
